feed.title: Current Watches, Warnings and Advisories for the United States Issued by the National Weather Service

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued August 31 at 9:45AM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...HEAVY RAIN FOR LATE WEEK INTO THE WEEKEND... A series of atmospheric rivers will move across the northern half of Southeast Alaska starting early Thursday near Yakutat, and then sliding over the northern inner channels on Friday. The heavier rain is then expected to last through Saturday morning before starting to diminish Saturday afternoon.

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued August 31 at 2:04AM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...High Water In The Noatak, Kobuk And Koyukuk Valleys... Rains continue in the Northwest Interior with additional rainfall amounts up to 1.5 inches in the Upper Kobuk and Upper Noatak Valleys, and along the south slopes of the Western Brooks Range through Friday morning. The Kobuk river has leveled off at this time, but streams and
entry.cap:areaDesc: Lower Kobuk and Noatak Valleys; Lower Koyukuk and Middle Yukon Valleys; Upper Kobuk and Noatak Valleys

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued August 31 at 1:58AM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...Gusty Winds Today... A weather front moving through the area will bring gusty winds to Fairbanks and Nenana. Winds gusting around 25 mph are expected in the Fairbanks area, while winds gusting to around 40 mph are expect around Anderson and Clear, and around 30 mph at Nenana and in the Nenana Hills.

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued August 31 at 3:59PM CDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...Brief Landspout Tornadoes Possible... At 259 PM MDT/359 PM CDT/, conditions are becoming favorable for the development of landspout tornadoes in and close to the Cheyenne and Sherman county borders. However, at this time it is unknown which if any storm would produce a landspout. Any landspouts which develop are expected to pose a limited threat.

At 144 PM CDT, Emergency management reported thunderstorms have produced heavy rain near Ira. Between 2 and 4 inches of rain have fallen. Highway 1606 east of Ira has been closed due to water running over the road.
